intro: Erodium malacoides var. genuinum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Geraniaceae family.
